meanings.definition: The ability of a surface to emit thermal radiation
meanings.sent1: The emissivity of the metal roof allowed it to release heat efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The high emissivity of the glass made it a good choice for solar panels.
meanings.sent3: The emissivity of the ice cream truck made it seem like it was giving off cool vibes.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had an emissivity that warmed the hearts of everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The emissivity of the sun on a summer day can be overwhelming.

meanings.definition: The ratio of the energy radiated by a surface to that radiated by a blackbody at the same temperature
meanings.sent1: The building material's low emissivity meant it absorbed more heat than it emitted.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use emissivity values to calculate the heat transfer of different materials.
meanings.sent3: The emissivity of the cat's fur compared to a blackbody was a topic of interest for the researchers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of emotions, her emissivity was unmatched, radiating positivity in all situations.
meanings.sent5: The emissivity of the moon on a clear night creates a magical glow in the sky.
